meanings.definition: A type of dance originating in Cuba.
meanings.sent1: At the party, everyone joined in the rumbas.
meanings.sent2: The rumbas at the festival were lively and colorful.
meanings.sent3: The rumbas made the crowd cheer and clap along.
meanings.sent4: Her movements on the dance floor were like graceful rumbas.
meanings.sent5: The music filled the room, setting the stage for the energetic rumbas.

meanings.sent1: In the dance class, they practiced different rumbas.
meanings.sent2: The collection included various rumbas from different regions.
meanings.sent3: The box was full of colorful rumbas waiting to be played.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a mix of rumbas, each with its own rhythm.
meanings.sent5: The market was bustling with vendors selling unique rumbas.
